clinical_study.official_title: Unrestricted Diet vs 1-day Low Residue Diet for Screening Colonoscopy

brief_summary.textblock: Colonoscopy is the technique of choice for the evaluation of the mucosa of the colon. To be able to do the procedure in optimal conditions, it needs to be clean. Therefore, it is necessary to carry out a preparation as safe and tolerable as possible. This preparation generally consists in a low residue diet the days before the colonoscopy and in the intake of a laxative solution. In previous studies, it has been shown that the low residue diet does not play a relevant role as it was considered before. Recent studies demonstrated that reducing the days of low residue diet does not worsen the cleansing and improves the patient experience. The results of this study are required for determining the role of diet restrictive diet in colon cleansing.

primary_outcome.description: Bowel cleansing as a rating using the Boston Bowel Preparation Scale above 1 in each segment . This score ranges fron 0 to 3 in each one of the three segments. Zero is the worst outcome and 3 is the best cleansing

secondary_outcome.measure: Diet tolerability as assessed by a likert scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The day of the colonoscopy just before beginning
secondary_outcome.description: Tolerance to the diet assigned to the participant measured with a likert scale from 0 to 5, 0 the worst ad 5 the best.

secondary_outcome.measure: Preparation tolerability as assessed by a likert scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The day of the colonoscopy just before beginning
secondary_outcome.description: Tolerance to the cleansing solution used for bowel cleansing measured with a likert scale from 0 to 5, 0 the worst ad 5 the best.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: With histology report, an average of 4 weeks after colonoscopy
secondary_outcome.description: An adenoma was detected, resected and confirmed by the histology report in the colonoscopy.
Polyp detection in the colonoscopy as reported by the endoscopist.
Time expended in reaching the cecum
Time expended in the withdrawal from cecum till the anus.

secondary_outcome.measure: Information perceived quality assessed by a likert scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The day of the colonoscopy just before beginning
secondary_outcome.description: Perceived quality of the instructions and education received for the colonoscopy preparation by the participant. Assessed using a likert scale

secondary_outcome.measure: Entry bowel cleansing as assessed by the modified Boston Bowel Preparation Scale
secondary_outcome.description: Bowel cleansing during cecum intubation phase assessed using a modified Boston Bowel Preparation Scale which is without considering any additional cleansing during the endoscopy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Colorectal cancer screening colonoscopy satisfaction and safety
secondary_outcome.description: Satisfaction and safety perceived by the patient assessed using a validated self administered survey "Colonoscopy Satisfaction and Safety Questionnaire (CSSQP) for Colorectal Cancer Screening" .

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of colonoscopies with flat polyps
secondary_outcome.description: Flat polyp detection defined by Paris criteria: no polypoid nor ulcerated (Paris 0-IIa/b/c) in the colonoscopy as reported by the endoscopist.

arm_group.description: The participant is not instructed to follow any dietary recommendation before colonoscopy. But only the restriction and fasting required for sedation.
The participant is instructed to follow a low residue diet the day before the colonoscopy. It will be given a informative document and educated by a nurse.

intervention.description: To follow a diet low in residues / fiber. the day before the colonoscopy.
If the participant is at risk of inadequate bowel cleansing, defined by a score of Dik et al ≥ 2 it will be given Bisacodyl 5 milgrams bid for 3 days.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Individuals on the early colorectal cancer detection program who agreed to undergo colonoscopy after positive results on the fecal immunochemical test (FIT)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Individuals in which colonoscopy, cleansing solution or bisacodyl are contraindicated
- Subjects that are considered to have a linguistic barrier or to be unable to understand the instructions and / or give informed consent.
